snippet: A Baltimore man who pleaded guilty to setting fire to a CVS store during a riot was sentenced in federal court to four years in prison.
abstract: Federal court in Baltimore sentences Raymon Carter to four years in prison and restitution of $500,000 after Carter pleaded guilty to setting CVS store on fire; incident caused $1.1 million in damages during city-wide riots in response to death of Freddie Gray.
lead_paragraph: A Baltimore man who pleaded guilty to setting fire to a CVS store during a riot was sentenced in federal court to four years in prison.

headline.main: Maryland: Four-Year Sentence for Man Who Set Fire in Riot
headline.print_headline: Maryland: Four-Year Sentence for Man Who Set Fire in Riot
